<line: 2> Case 4:16-cr-02302-CKJ-LAB Document 39 Filed 05/16/17 Page 1 of 5

[TITLE]
<line: 4> IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT
<line: 5> FOR THE DISTRICT OF ARIZONA

[TITLE]
<line: 7> United States of America.

[TEXT]
<line: 9> JUDGMENT IN A CRIMINAL CASE
<line: 10> (For Offenses Committed On or After November 1, 1987)

[TEXT]
<line: 12> v.
<line: 13> Daniel Enos

[TEXT]
<line: 15> No. CR-16-02302-001-TUC-CKJ (LAB)

[TEXT]
<line: 17> John D. Kaufmann (CJA)
<line: 18> Attorney for Defendant

[TEXT]
<line: 20> USM#: 69724-408

[TEXT]
<line: 22> THE DEFENDANT ENTERED A PLEA OF guilty on 2/16/2017 to Counts 1 and 3 of the
<line: 23> Indictment.

[TEXT]
<line: 25> ACCORDINGLY, THE COURT HAS ADJUDICATED THAT THE DEFENDANT IS.GUILTY
<line: 26> OF THE FOLLOWING OFFENSE(S): violating Title 18, U.S.C. j113(a)(3) and 1153, Assault with
<line: 27> a Dangerous Weapon, a Class C Felony offense, as charged in Count 1 of the Indictment; Title 18
<line: 28> U.S.C. 113(a)(3) and 1153, Assault with a Dangerous Weapon, a Class C Felony offense, as charged
<line: 29> in Count 3 of the Indictment..

[TEXT]
<line: 31> IT IS THE JUDGMENT OF THIS COURT THAT the defendant is committed to the custody of the
<line: 32> Bureau of Prisons for a term of FIFTEEN (15) MONTHS on each of Count 1 and on Count 3, said
<line: 33> counts to run concurrently, with credit for time served. Upon release from imprisonment, the defendant.
<line: 34> shall be placed on supervised release for a term of THREE (3) YEARS on each of Count 1 and on
<line: 35> Count 3, said counts to run concurrently.

[TEXT]
<line: 37> IT IS ORDERED that all remaining counts are dismissed on motion of the United States..

[TITLE]
<line: 39> CRIMINAL MONETARY PENALTIES

[TEXT]
<line: 41> The defendant shall pay to the Clerk the following total criminal monetary penalties:.

[TEXT]
<line: 43> SPECIAL ASSESSMENT: $200.00
<line: 44> FINE: WAIVED
<line: 45>  RESTITUTION: N/A

[TEXT]
<line: 47> The defendant shall pay a special assessment of $200.00 which shall be due immediately.

[TEXT]
<line: 49> The Court finds the defendant does not have the ability to pay a fine and orders the fine waived.

[TEXT]
<line: 51> If incarcerated, payment of criminal monetary penalties are due during imprisonment at a rate of not less than $25 per quarter.
<line: 52> and payment shall be made through the Bureau of Prisons' Inmate Financial Responsibility Program. Criminal monetary
<line: 53> payments shall be made to the Clerk of U.S. District Court, Attention: Finance, Suite 130, 401 West Washington Street, SPC 1,
<line: 54> Phoenix, Arizona 85003-2118. Payments should be credited to the various monetary penalties imposed by the Court in the
<line: 55> priority established under 18 U.S.C.  3612(c). The total special assessment of $200.00 shall be paid pursuant to Title 18,
<line: 56> United States Code, Section 3013 for Count 1 and 3 of the Indictment..1231231

[ABANDON]

[ABANDON]
<line: 7> Page 2 of 5

[TEXT]
<line: 9> Any unpaid balance shall become a condition of supervision and shall be paid within 90 days prior to the expiration of
<line: 10> supervision. Until all restitutions, fines, special assessments and costs are fully paid, the defendant shall immediately notify the.
<line: 11> Clerk, U.S. District Court, of any change in name and address. The Court hereby waives the imposition of interest and penalties.
<line: 12> on any unpaid balances.

[TITLE]
<line: 14> SUPERVISED RELEASE

[TEXT]
<line: 16> It is the order of the Court that, pursuant to General Order 16-23, which incorporates the requirements.
<line: 17> of USSG $85B1.3 and 5D1.2, you shall comply with the following conditions:

[TITLE]
<line: 19>  MANDATORY CONDITIONS

[TEXT]
<line: 21> 1)
<line: 22> You must not commit another federal, state or local crime.
<line: 23> 2)
<line: 24> You must not unlawfully possess a controlled substance. The use or possession of marijuana,
<line: 25> even with a physician's certification, is not permitted.
<line: 26> 3)
<line: 27> You must refrain from any unlawful use of a controlled substance. The use or possession of
<line: 28> marijuana, even with a physician's certification, is not permitted. Unless suspended by the Court,
<line: 29> you must submit to one drug test within 15 days of release from imprisonment and at least two
<line: 30> periodic drug tests thereafter, as determined by the court.
<line: 31> 4)
<line: 32> If convicted of a felony or any other qualifying offense, you must cooperate in the collection of
<line: 33> DNA as directed by the probation officer..

[TITLE]
<line: 35> STANDARD CONDITIONS

[TEXT]
<line: 37>  You must report to the probation office in the federal judicial district where you are authorized
<line: 38> to reside within 72 hours of sentencing or your release from imprisonment, unless the probation
<line: 39> officer instructs you to report to a different probation office or within a different time frame.
<line: 40> 2)
<line: 41> After initially reporting to the probation office, you will receive instructions from the court or
<line: 42> the probation officer about how and when you must report to the probation officer, and you must
<line: 43> report to the probation officer as instructed.
<line: 44> 3)
<line: 45> You must not knowingly leave the federal judicial district where you are authorized to reside
<line: 46> without first getting permission from the court or the probation officer.
<line: 47> 4)
<line: 48> You must answer truthfully the questions asked by your probation officer.
<line: 49> 5)
<line: 50> You must live at a place approved by the probation officer. If you plan to change where you live
<line: 51> or anything about your living arrangements (such as the people you live with), you must notify
<line: 52> the probation officer at Ieast 10 days before the change. If notifying the.probation officer in
<line: 53> advance is not possible due to unanticipated circumstances, you must notify the probation
<line: 54> officer within 72 hours of becoming aware of a change or expected change.
<line: 55> You must allow the probation officer to visit you at any time at your home or elsewhere, and

[TEXT]
<line: 57> 6)1231231

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 4:16-cr-02302-CKJ-LAB Document 39 Filed 05/16/17 Page 3 of 5

[ABANDON]

<line: 5> USA vs. Daniel Enos

[ABANDON]
<line: 7> Page 3 of 5

[TEXT]
<line: 9> you must permit the probation officer to take any items prohibited by the conditions of your
<line: 10> supervision that he or she observes in plain view.

[TEXT]
<line: 12> 7)
<line: 13> You must work full time (at least 30 hours per week) at a lawful type of employment, unless the
<line: 14> probation officer excuses you from doing so. If you do not have full-time employment you inust
<line: 15> try to find full-time employment, unless the probation officer excuses you from doing so. If you
<line: 16>  plan to change where you work or anything about your work (such as your position or your job
<line: 17> responsibilities), you must notify the probation officer at least 10 days before the change. If
<line: 18> notifying the probation officer at Ieast 10 days in advance is not possible due to unanticipated
<line: 19> circumstances, you must notify the probation officer within 72 hours of becoming aware of a
<line: 20> change or expected change.

[TEXT]
<line: 22> 8)
<line: 23> You must not communicate or interact with someone you know is engaged in criminal activity.
<line: 24> If you know someone has been convicted of a felony, you must not knowingly communicate or.
<line: 25> interact with that person without first getting the permission of the probation officer.

[TEXT]
<line: 27> 9)
<line: 28> If you are arrested or questioned by a law enforcement officer, you must notify the probation
<line: 29> officer within 72 hours..
<line: 30> 10)

[TEXT]
<line: 32> You must not own, possess, or have access to a firearm, ammunition, destructive device, or
<line: 33> dangerous weapon (i.e., anything that was designed, or was modified for, the specific purpose of
<line: 34> causing bodily injury or death to another person such as nunchakus or tasers)..
<line: 35> You must not act or make any agreement with a law enforcement agency to act as a confidential.

[TEXT]
<line: 37> 11)
<line: 38> human source or informant without first getting the permission of the court..
<line: 39> 12)
<line: 40>  If the probation officer determines that you pose a risk to another person (including an

[TEXT]
<line: 42> organization), the probation officer may require you to notify the person about the risk and you
<line: 43> must comply with that instruction. The probation officer may contact the person and confirm
<line: 44> that you have notified the person about the risk..

[TEXT]
<line: 46> 13)
<line: 47> You must follow the instructions of the probation officer related to the conditions of
<line: 48> supervision.

[TITLE]
<line: 50> SPECIAL CONDITIONS

[TEXT]
<line: 52> The following special conditions are in addition to the conditions of supervised release or'supersede
<line: 53> any related standard condition:

[TEXT]
<line: 55> 1) . You shall participate as instructed by the probation officer in a program of substance abuse
<line: 56> treatment which may include testing for substance abuse. You shall contribute to the cost of
<line: 57> treatment in an amount to be determined by the probation officer..
<line: 58> 2)
<line: 59> You shall submit your person, property, house, residence, vehicle, papers, or office, to a search
<line: 60> conducted by a probation officer. Failure to submit to a search may be grounds for revocation of1231231

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 4:16-cr-02302-CKJ-LAB Document 39 Filed 05/16/17 Page 4 of 5

[ABANDON]
<line: 4> CR-16-02302-001-TUC-CKJ (LAB)
<line: 5> USA vs. Daniel Enos

[ABANDON]
<line: 7> Page 4 of 5

[TEXT]
<line: 9> release. You shall warn any other occupants that the premises may be subject to searches
<line: 10> pursuant to this condition..
<line: 11> 3)
<line: 12> You shall participate in a mental health program as directed by the probation officer which may
<line: 13> include taking prescribed medication. You shall contribute to the cost of treatment in an amount
<line: 14> to be determined by the probation officer.
<line: 15> 4)
<line: 16> At the discretion of the probation officer, you shall actively participate in a residential program
<line: 17> as directed by the probation officer until discharged by the probation officer, but not to exceed
<line: 18> 180 days without a Court review. Placement may include, singularly or in any combination, a
<line: 19>  residential re-entry center, a halfway house, inpatient drug treatment or a drug-free sober living
<line: 20> environment as selected by the probation officer..
<line: 21> 5)
<line: 22> You shall not contact the following victim(s), M.E. and M.B. without prior approval of the
<line: 23> probation officer at the discretion of the probation officer. The probation officer will verify
<line: 24> compliance.
<line: 25> 6)
<line: 26> You shall not be involved with gang activity, possess any gang paraphernalia or associate with
<line: 27> any person affiliated with a gang..
<line: 28> 7)
<line: 29> You shall abstain from all use of alcohol or alcoholic beverages..
<line: 30> 8)
<line: 31> You shall reside in residence approved, in advance, by the probation officer. Any changes in the
<line: 32> residence must be pre-approved in writing by the probation officer..
<line: 33> 9)
<line: 34> You shall not be in possession of any weapons or firearms..
<line: 35> 10)
<line: 36> You shall participate in a tattoo removal program at the discretion of the probation officer.
<line: 37> 11)
<line: 38> Defendants alcohol consumption shall be monitored with ankle bracelet at the discretion of the
<line: 39> probation officer.

[TEXT]
<line: 41> THE COURT FINDs that you have been sentenced in accordance with the terms of the plea.
<line: 42> agreement and that you have waived your right to appeal and to collaterally attack this matter. The.
<line: 43> waiver has been knowingly and voluntarily made with a factual basis and with an understanding of the
<line: 44> consequences of the waiver..

[TEXT]
<line: 46> The Court may change the conditions of probation or supervised release or extend the term of.
<line: 47> supervision, if less than the authorized maximum, at any time during the period of probation or.
<line: 48> supervised release. The Court may issue a warrant and revoke the original or any subsequent sentence.
<line: 49> for a violation occurring during the period of probation or supervised release..

[TEXT]
<line: 51> The Court orders commitment to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons and recommends that the
<line: 52> defendant be designated to a facility in or near southern Arizona to facilitate family visitations.

[ABANDON]1231231
